title: Calculate Your Website Redesign ROI
excerpt: Use our calculator to estimate the return on investment for your website redesign project.
content:
Your website is more than just a digital brochure‚Äîit's a revenue-generating asset. But how do you know if investing in a redesign will actually pay off?

In this guide, we'll walk you through the exact framework we use to calculate ROI for our clients, plus give you access to our interactive calculator to run your own numbers.

sections.heading: Why Website ROI Matters
sections.content:
Too many businesses treat their website as an expense rather than an investment. This mindset leads to underinvestment in one of your most important marketing channels.

When you understand the true ROI potential of your website, you can make informed decisions about where to allocate your marketing budget. Our clients typically see a 300-500% ROI within the first year of a redesign.

author: Echo Web Team

title: How Much Does a Professional Website Cost?
excerpt: Interactive pricing calculator to estimate your website project investment.
content:
Website pricing can be confusing. Projects range from $1,000 to $100,000+ depending on complexity and features.

Use our interactive calculator below to get a realistic estimate for your project based on the features and functionality you need.

sections.heading: What Affects Website Pricing
sections.content:
Several factors influence website costs: design complexity, custom functionality, content management system, e-commerce features, and ongoing maintenance needs.

Understanding these factors helps you budget appropriately and avoid surprise costs down the road.

title: The Complete Website Redesign Process
excerpt: A step-by-step breakdown of our proven website redesign methodology.
content:
Redesigning a website is a significant investment. Understanding the process helps set expectations and ensures a successful outcome.

We've refined our process over hundreds of projects to deliver results on time and on budget.

sections.heading: Why Process Matters
sections.content:
A structured process ensures nothing gets missed and keeps projects on track. It also provides clear milestones so you always know where you stand.

Our process is designed to maximize collaboration while minimizing revisions and delays.

author: Echo Web Team

data.title: Our 6-Step Website Redesign Process
data.description: From discovery to launch and beyond

steps.title: Discovery & Strategy
steps.description: We audit your current site, analyze competitors, and define goals. This phase includes stakeholder interviews and user research to inform our strategy.

steps.title: Wireframing & Planning
steps.description: We create wireframes showing page layouts and user flows. This ensures we have a solid foundation before moving into design.

steps.title: Design & Prototyping
steps.description: Our designers create high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes. We iterate based on your feedback until the design is perfect.

steps.title: Development
steps.description: We build your site using modern technologies and best practices. The site is developed responsively for all devices.

steps.title: Testing & QA
steps.description: Rigorous testing across browsers and devices ensures everything works flawlessly before launch.

steps.title: Launch & Optimization
steps.description: We launch your site and monitor performance. Post-launch optimization ensures you're getting maximum results.

title: DIY vs Agency vs Freelancer: Website Options Compared
excerpt: An honest comparison of different approaches to building your website.
content:
Choosing how to build your website is one of the most important decisions for your business. Each option has tradeoffs.

This comprehensive comparison helps you make an informed decision based on your budget, timeline, and needs.

sections.heading: Understanding Your Options
sections.content:
You have three main options: build it yourself with a website builder, hire a freelancer, or work with an agency. Each has distinct advantages and limitations.

The right choice depends on your technical skills, budget, timeline, and long-term goals.
